event.title: created by the New Madrid earthquakes of 1811

data.event: The history of Lake County has been largely defined by Reelfoot Lake, a natural lake created by the New Madrid earthquakes of 1811 and 1812.

event.title: was established by the state legislature in 1870

data.event: The county was established by the state legislature in 1870.

event.title: 1862, during the Civil War, the Battle of Island Number Ten took

data.event: In 1862, during the Civil War, the Battle of Island Number Ten took place in the Mississippi River, just off the shores of what is now Lake County.
In 1907, a violent conflict took place in Lake and Obion counties when a private company, the West Tennessee Land Company, gained control of Reelfoot Lake and announced plans to drain it.

event.title: gained title to the lake in 1914

data.event: The state gained title to the lake in 1914, and the lake was designated as a hunting and fishing reserve by Governor Austin Peay in 1925.

event.title: was designated as a hunting and fishing reserve by Governor Austin Peay in 1925

data.event: The state gained title to the lake in 1914, and the lake was designated as a hunting and fishing reserve by Governor Austin Peay in 1925.
